parts.text:
```json
{
"application": "SLURM",
"details": {
"software": [
"Singularity",
"Python 3",
"PointNet"
],
"resources": {
"nodes": 1,
"tasks_per_node": 1,
"gpus": 1,
"cpus_per_task": 8,
"time": "40 minutes",
"memory_per_gpu": "64GB",
"output_file": "/workspaces/%u/thesisdlradardetection/PointNet/Pnet_pytorch/log/hal_logs/testings/slurm_inference-%j-run.out",
"partition": "ztest",
"bind_paths": [
"/workspaces/$USER:/workspace",
"/staging/thesisradardetection:/RadarScenes"
],
"environment_variables": [
"PYTHONPATH=."
]
}
}
```

The script utilizes the SLURM workload manager to run a Python script using PointNet for radar semantic segmentation. It uses Singularity to run the script in a containerized environment.  The script requires several resources like one node, one GPU, and 8 CPUs per task.  It also uses a custom partition "ztest" and binds specific paths for the container to access files and directories.
